original_title: Indo Lanka Chamber of Commerce and Industry extends congratulations to new Govt.
original_body_lines: The Membership and Executive Committee of the Indo Lanka Chamber of Commerce and Industry (ILCCI) extend their warmest congratulations to the newly elected Government and all Members of Parliament. This historic occasion marks a fresh chapter in Sri Lanka’s journey toward progress, and ILCCI is filled with optimism for the positive transformation that lies ahead.

ILCCI is confident that, under the dynamic and astute leadership of the new Government, Sri Lanka will embrace a culture of integrity, good governance, and sustainable development. This leadership is crucial not only to addressing the immediate challenges but also to laying the foundation for long-term prosperity and equity across the nation.

Since its inception in 2006, the ILCCI has been a steadfast partner in fostering trade, investment, and tourism between Sri Lanka and India. Operating under the aegis of The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce, its chamber brings together a diverse membership of Sri Lankan businesses, Sri Lankan-Indian joint ventures, and Indian businesses incorporated in Sri Lanka, representing a wide array of industries and trades.

The Government’s policies and vision for economic growth resonate deeply with its mission. As the Government embarks on this vital journey of governance, the ILCCI pledges its unwavering support to its efforts. It stands ready to collaborate in driving sustainable and inclusive economic growth, creating opportunities for all Sri Lankans.

ILCCI is particularly eager to work together to strengthen bilateral relations between Sri Lanka and India. Under the Government’s leadership, it hopes to see a significant boost in trade, investment, and tourism between our two nations. By fostering stronger economic ties and improving the ease of doing business, it believes both countries can unlock their full potential and achieve mutual prosperity.

As a trusted partner in this journey, the ILCCI is committed to playing a proactive role in these endeavours. Whether it is facilitating cross-border partnerships, supporting policy initiatives, or advocating for industry needs, it will continue to contribute to building a thriving economic ecosystem.

ILCCI wishes the new Government every success in this noble mission to uplift the nation and its people. With a clear vision, steadfast determination, and the support of all stakeholders, it is confident that Sri Lanka will move towards a brighter and more prosperous future.
